main event: A person in Syracuse, New York observed a large, bright silver-white object approaching from the east that appeared to come to a stop and then make circling movements before disappearing.
interesting points: The object did not make any noise during the observation.
The object appeared to grow smaller as it receded towards the east.
The observer took a photograph and a slide of the object, but the cause of the imagery could not be positively identified.
The observer reported that the object made two one-minute flights over the city, disappearing momentarily and then returning.
The observer stated that their eyesight and hearing were excellent, and they would have been able to hear any type of known propulsion if it was involved.
photographs: yes, a photograph and slide were taken but could not be positively identified
